div.strong: for pick-up and delivery to all children 18 years and under.

div.div: Monday - Friday: Curb-side pick up only at Columbia Elementary School, between 11:00am and Noon, while supplies last.

div.span: Monday - Thursday: Bus stop locations and times are listed below.

div.div: Meals are provided while school is out of session due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The program is made available in cooperation with CESD, CDE and USDA.

div.p: The Local Control and Accountability Plan or LCAP is a critical part of California's new Local Control Funding Formula (LCFF). It is a three-year, district-level plan that is updated annually. The plan describes the school district's key goals for students as well as the specific actions (with expenditures) the district will take to achieve the goals and means (metrics) used to measure progress. EC Section 52060(d)

p.strong: 2019-20 LCAP and Budget Overview for Parents

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 20px; padding: 0px; border: 0px; font-variant-numeric: inherit; font-variant-east-asian: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; line-height: 24px; vertical-align: baseline; color: #333333;

div.p: Statkeholders are encouraged to provide feedback during the 2020-21 LCAP development cycle. Input may be provided at monthly Board of Education meetings, community meetings, or individually via email columbiaboard@columbiasd.com.

div.p: The official Columbia Elementary School District app gives you a personalized window into what is happening at the district and schools. Get the news and information that you care about, and get involved.
